ygData.subject: Re: O/T I'll probably get flamed for this by some, but..
ygData.msgSnippet: Definately, I agree with the magic system.  I was worried when I first read about it, as mage-class is usually a very popular class. But when you think bout
ygData.messageBody:
Definately, I agree with the magic system. I was worried when I first
read about it, as mage-class is usually a very popular class. But when you
think 'bout it, it'll definately add an air of mystery, and I think the
class will level itself out. :-) I also like how you find your spells and
such, with the phrases, gestures, and reagents and can experiment to create
your own. I think it pulls you into the world better along with how the
magic system works out.

The major draw back I see to Asheron's Call is the world. First, I
think Dereth is a silly name for a Fantasy world (Norath is certainly much
better a name:), and then there's the size. The size of road island, they
say. Well great, Antonica is probably bigger than that in and of itself.
:-) I hope they'll add more. Just so you folks know I'm not trashing EQ.
;)

As for the graphics...from what I've seen in the videos it's smoother,
but then they always use spiffy 3D cards for things like that. With the
leaves and all, the impression I got from the A'sC website was that the
fallen leaves would blow across the ground, whereas in EQ it's the leaves in
the trees.

I'm going to have to look into this a bit more. EQ may have some
competition. ;) But I don't think it'll hurt EQ by a long shot.

~Mysk

> From: Patrickje1@...
>
> Im not sure of the exact date that asheron's call is going to be out but I
> know its not real soon. If you read the postings on various sites about
the
> new eq edition coming out the first quarter of next year its adding
swaying
> leaves(using less pixels!) and tons of other great additions including the
> new continent it will be more than enough to match asheron's call. The
one
> thing though that I did read about asheron's call is about discovering new
> spells( kind of like research but better) and the advantages to keeping
the
> spells secret so there arent a lot of spoilers. That would definately add
a
> new angle on spell casting in eq if they added something similar to that.
>
> ~Dracor on Erollisi Marr
